page.title: 19Police in Bulford
page.content: I interviewed Sergeant Durnford to find out how Bulford Village/Camp is policed.Bulford has no living in policemen, but a sergeant and four men based in Amesbury have an office at Bulford Camp.Because of the military presence there is a strong liason between the Royal Military Police and the Civilian Police.Minor crimes on Camp are dealt with by the M.P.'s. Stealing from cars, meters, occupied and unoccupied houses are the major crimes.As too is the stealing of cars left unattended whilst soldiers are on exercise.Of great concern is the number of sex offences involving under age girls.There is no serious drug/ solvent abuse problem. The policing is done by mobile and bicycle and there is always a back up by Traffic Division in Salisbury for more serious incidents and accidents.
